meanings.definition: Covered or enclosed in a tunic.
meanings.sent1: The tunicated man looked elegant in his flowing garment.
meanings.sent2: She admired the tunicated design of the ancient statue.
meanings.sent3: The tunicated cat strutted around as if it owned the place.
meanings.sent4: The tunicated tree branches intertwined like a protective shield.
meanings.sent5: The tunicated fabric draped gracefully over the chair.

meanings.sent1: The tunicated warriors marched proudly into battle.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed tunicated armor from different eras.
meanings.sent3: The tunicated siblings always dressed alike for family gatherings.
meanings.sent4: The tunicated walls of the castle stood strong against invaders.
meanings.sent5: The tunicated costumes added authenticity to the historical play.

meanings.sent1: The tunicated actors performed a captivating scene on stage.
meanings.sent2: The festival attendees admired the tunicated dancers.
meanings.sent3: The tunicated knights rode proudly in the royal procession.
meanings.sent4: The tunicated athletes moved gracefully in the arena.
meanings.sent5: The tunicated choir sang harmoniously during the ceremony.
